0.Pros: My store has great managers and that makes it bearable.

1.Pros: I have the day to do what I need to.
1.Cons: not a whole lot of money for the work.

3.Pros: Mostly good coworkers, free food (which I've heard has now been limited and maybe even taken away).
3.Cons: Didn't get requested time off even though I requested it months in advance, was made to come in with a fever of 103, while other workers called out to go to the beach with their friends and had no repercussions (don't know why I cared so much about that job that I was willing to do that), no appreciation for being a great and loyal employee, in fact, we got a new manager and he didn't like me for no reason. Others were asked to go to manager classes that had been there less time than I had. Obviously very few raises, maybe 10 cents ever 6 months or something stupid like that, they were obsessed with their service times and policies, it was not that serious, its a fast food joint and were being paid minimum wage.

4.Pros: Flexible hours, corporate training, move fast up chain
4.Cons: Terrible management, non-caring franchise owners, low pay

5.Pros: The management was amazing and respected the employees
5.Cons: The only bad part was that most teenagers never wanted to come in for their shift

7.Pros: The discount is good at 50%. I also enjoy the meal on break and free drinks. The pay isn't half bad for a starter job either.
7.Cons: They schedule you lots at first to understand your skill level and get you trained so you can start working alongside everyone else.

8.Summary: "Not only A but an A+ company"
8.Pros: 1. Solid & full function training program, especially valuable for Trainee2. Good teamwork spirit3. Recognize people rather than punish them
8.Cons: 1. Too SOP-oriented2. Less competitive wages for part-time employees

9.Pros: It's starting to get better with the way it's being ran
9.Cons: They need to start working as a team
